question: I had a CRP test which came back at a level of 20.5.  Other tests are now being run for autoimmune diseases such as lupus, fibromyalgia, rheumatoid arthritis, etc. I guess to eliminate that is the problem if I understood it right.  I am overweight and have high blood pressure (take medication for this).  Cholesterol reading wasn't bad.  No diabetes.  Thyroid was good.  Anyway.....how concerned should I be by this high level of CRP?  I did have knee surgery two months ago and am still sore (tore meniscus, did lateral for tilted knee, did a microfracture drilling holes into the bone, and they found some arthritis).  Could this cause levels to be increased in any way?BabsThis discussion is related tohttp://www.medhelp.org/posts/show/252215.
title: CRP Test
